text: Northeast India (officially North Eastern Region, NER) refers to the easternmost region of the Republic of India. When India became independent, it was split into the states that are now India, Pakistan, and Bangladesh. Northeast India lies to the east of Bangladesh. It includes the states of Arunachal Pradesh, Assam, Manipur, Meghalaya, Mizoram, Nagaland, and Tripura, which are called the "seven sister states", and seldom also Sikkim. == Provincial symbols of Northeast India regions == File:Great- Hornbill.jpg|Provincial bird of Northeast Indian region File:Indian Rhino (Rhinoceros unicornis)1 - Relic38.jpg|Provincial animal of Northeast Indian region File:MesuaFerrea IronWood.jpg|Indian rose Chestnut, provincial tree of Northeast Indian region File:Rhynchostylis gigantea 2.jpg|Provincial flower of North-east Indian region
title: Northeast India
